subject: Investing
title: Market Bubbles: Psychology in Action
description: A fast breakdown of Market Bubbles: Psychology in Action for builders.

hook.text: Dutch tulip bulbs cost more than houses in 1637. Then prices crashed 90% in weeks.

buildup.text: Bubbles follow a pattern: displacement, boom, euphoria, profit-taking, panic.

discovery.text: Every bubble is powered by the belief that 'this time is different'â€”and it never really is.

twist.text: Bubbles are obvious only in hindsight. During the boom, skeptics are mocked as out of touch.

climax.text: When taxi drivers and family dinners buzz about a single asset, the bubble is likely near its peak.

punchline.text: Bubbles are fueled by greed and popped by gravity. History always wins.
